definitions.definition: To refrain from (doing something, using something etc.), to stop/cease (doing something).
definitions.example: He had to cut out smoking in order to be prepared for the marathon
If we cut out the middle-man, we will both have better profits.
The cowboy cut out the unbranded heifers.

definitions.definition: To stop working, to switch off; (of a person on the telephone etc.) to be inaudible, be disconnected.
definitions.example: Can you say that again? You keep cutting out.
He must have cut out of the party.

definitions.definition: (usually in passive) To arrange or prepare.
definitions.example: He has his work cut out for him.

definitions.definition: To take a ship out of a harbor etc. by getting between her and the shore.
Well suited; appropriate; fit for a particular activity or purpose.
definitions.example: I'm not really cut out for camping outdoors. I'm allergic to mosquito bites.
